title: Active Alignment Process / Test Development Engineer
summary: We live in a mobile and device driven world where knowledge of the physical world around us is needed. We rely on this knowledge to get around, to learn about our environment and to enable spectacular new features for custom applications. Apple is meeting those needs as robustly and as creatively as possible and is interested in people who want to help meet that commitment. The success we are striving will be the result of very skilled people working in an environment which cultivates creativity, partnership, and thinking of old problems in new ways. If that sounds like the kind of environment that you find intriguing, then let's talk. These elements come together to make Apple an amazing environment for motivated people to do the greatest work of their lives. You will become part of a team that sets the standard in cultivating excellence, creativity, and innovation. You will have the opportunity to be responsible for developing a test plan & metrics for the characterization of photonics products as well as test system and methodology for characterizing photonics products. Will you help us design the next generation of revolutionary Apple products?
description:
- Work closely with an external vendor and an internal team to deliver an active alignment (or test) process for a new optical module in the engineering phase (small quantity).
- Establish process and metrics.
- Conduct process and machine bring up.
- Fine-tune and sustain operation in the engineering phase.
- Conduct post-build follow-up such as FACA (failure analysis and corrective action) on yield loss, process improvement, and etc.
preferred_qualifications: Expertise in either 1) optics attach (active alignment) process or 2) optical functionality test of optical devices (for example camera, projector, range finder, flashlight, proximity sensor, and etc). Experience with developing a new process and equipment for new optical devices. Experience in tooling-up an existing machine for new optical devices. Clear and effective written and communication skill.
